_inspectorSnowReport.Report: Wednesday February 18, 5:05 a.m.  Boom! Mother nature continues to deliver the goods. We grabbed 19 inches of fresh snow in the past 24 hours, and the free refills are still coming in. The skiing and riding is soft, poppy, and playful right now. Some delays on lifts and terrain are expected today as patrol assesses the mountain and conducts avalanche mitigation work as needed with the new snow.  Today is forecast to be the main event, with a whopping 12 to 18 inches of snow expected during the day and another 4 to 6 inches projected overnight. Bundle up, the high today is 20 degrees, but the wind chill is expected to feel like 1 degree. Moderate to strong winds and snowy skies will persist throughout the day. So, grab your crew and your powder skis and boards and come surf the white wave. Theres plenty of powder hiding in the trees and off-trail and the groomers are extra creamy right now. Stay warm and have a blast out on the mountain today!

The skiing and riding is soft, poppy, and playful right now. Today is forecast to be the main event, with a whopping 12 to 18 inches of snow expected during the day and another 4 to 6 inches projected overnight. Bundle up, the high today is 20 degrees, but the wind chill is expected to feel like 1 degree. Moderate to strong winds and snowy skies will persist throughout the day. So, grab your crew and your powder skis and boards and come surf the white wave. Theres plenty of powder hiding in the trees and off-trail and the groomers are extra creamy right now. Head up high to Summit Express for the deepest turns. Stay warm and have a blast out on the mountain today!
_inspectorSnowReport.Alert: 11 inches of new snow since lifts closed!
